intro: Phyteuma pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has a fibrous root system and hairy stems, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and rocky areas. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, making it a valuable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
